intro: Boerhavia octandra, commonly known as redroot sandplum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pink to red flowers. The plant has small, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Boerhavia octandra is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
